title: Prediction Of Soil Accuracy Using Data Mining Techniques
venue: International Conference on Computing Communication Control and automation

abstract: This paper gives ideas for today's agriculture problem and provides the efficient optimization methods and effective crop planning with the utilization of minimum resources. Total growth of the nation is depended on the agronomy and agronomy is depended on the soil and water. In this paper we provide the idea of different irrigation technique through this you can utilize minimum water and increase maximum yield. Also, the farmer not aware about diverse guidelines and policy provided by the government. In this study we overlook on farmer's choice of crops, irrigation facilities and type of soil. The most important job of this paper is to calculate the soil precision with the help of different Data mining classification algorithm such as JRip and Naive Bayes. In this paper we consider two type of soil Red and Black depending on this type of soil we examine the accuracy then we found JRip classification technique gives more accuracy as compared to na√Øve Bayes.
